reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Organisational support for UN Association of Finland

description.narrative: The UN Association of Finland is a Non-Governmental Organization that promotes and supports the actions and principles of the United Nations. UNA Finland was founded in 1954. The Association provides education and educational material regarding global resp onsibility and advocacy work delivers and produces news items relating to the UN and influences Finnish UN policy. The UN Association?s work contributes to the achievement of Finnish development cooperation objectives and adheres to the principles of the F innish Development Policy programme. UNA Finland does global education to increase awareness of the UN's activities further general understanding of human rights and support active citizenship. The goals of sustainable development are central principles in guiding UNA Finland's global education. The Association aims for lasting results and permanent change in attitudes and practices with its global education programme. The main target audience is teachers pedagogy students and voluntary educators from membe r associations. During 2015-16 the basis will be laid for the systematic communication on the Post 2015 Agenda for various target groups as well as the monitoring of the agenda in collaboration with other civil society actors. The activities in 2015-16 inc lude e.g. a school visit programme information about UN Conventions and the UN Post 2015 development goals. Year 2015 is the United Nations 70th anniversary year which will be utilised in communications work. The Finnish UN Association receives organisatio nal support for its information and development education activities from 2015 onwards.
